results.title: Antifungal activity of silver nanoparticles and simvastatin against toxigenic species of Aspergillus.
results.text_hl: Ultrastructural analysis revealed that spore germination was prevented, or aberrant hyphae were formed with multilateral branches upon treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ and AgNPs. These results reveal potential benefits of using combination of AgNPs and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ to control @<m>DISEASE_Mycoses</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009181 @@@fungal@@@ growth.

citations.NLM: Bocate KP, Reis GF, de Souza PC, Oliveira Junior AG, Durán N, Nakazato G, Furlaneto MC, de Almeida RS, Panagio LA. Antifungal activity of silver nanoparticles and simvastatin against toxigenic species of Aspergillus. Int J Food Microbiol. 2019 Feb 16;291():79-86. PMID: 30476736
citations.BibTeX: @article{30476736, title={Antifungal activity of silver nanoparticles and simvastatin against toxigenic species of Aspergillus.}, author={Bocate KP and Reis GF and de Souza PC and Oliveira Junior AG and Durán N and Nakazato G and Furlaneto MC and de Almeida RS and Panagio LA}, journal={Int J Food Microbiol}, volume={291}, pages={79-86}}

results.title: In vitro interactions between primycin and different statins in their effects against some clinically important fungi.
results.text_hl: The fungi exhibited different degrees of sensitivity to the statins; @CHEMICAL_Fluvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077340 @@@fluvastatin@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Fluvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077340 @@@FLV@@@) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@) exerted potent antifungal activities against a wide variety of clinically important @<m>DISEASE_Mycoses</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009181 @@@fungal pathogens@@@.

citations.NLM: Nyilasi I, Kocsubé S, Pesti M, Lukács G, Papp T, Vágvölgyi C. In vitro interactions between primycin and different statins in their effects against some clinically important fungi. J Med Microbiol. 2010 Feb;59(Pt 2):200-205. PMID: 19875509
citations.BibTeX: @article{19875509, title={In vitro interactions between primycin and different statins in their effects against some clinically important fungi.}, author={Nyilasi I and Kocsubé S and Pesti M and Lukács G and Papp T and Vágvölgyi C}, journal={J Med Microbiol}, volume={59}, number={Pt 2}, pages={200-205}}
